bibl.title: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], October 20, 1879

div1.p: Reed learns that McPherson will return to Fort Apache. Reed refers to other soldiers, and teases McPherson.

div1.head: Letter fragment from Walter Reed to [Dorsey M. McPherson], October 20, 1879
div1.p:
Your favor to hand, per ur-
-banity of Serg't. Hemming- The money was placed
within the grasp of Wm, the Conqueror & Scouter,
and the amount duly “chalked off,” as desired.
Am very glad to hear that you will get back
to Apache by middle of November - saw a letter
from the “Daisy” to Mr Staples, in which he
stated that he would be a Thomas on or
before the 10th of Novr- I think your re-
solves to virtuously abstain from all
murmurings of the spirit and commun-
-ings with “old Satan” are very wise,
and reflect credit upon your cranium.
Indeed, I should be very sorry to
think that my boy, Dorsey, was rip-
-ping around amongst the Oak's &Pines
and swearing like a genuine “tea-pot”!
On the Contrary, in my mind's eye I see
you in a much more pleasing attitude-
viz: with the Anatomy of Herr Gray
spread before you; your chin grace-
